snippet: Online dating sites defend the usefulness of their scientific approach. But a social psychology professor says that “technology is not the way to figure out who is compatible and will never be.”
abstract: Jenna Wortham Bits column examines the appeal of online dating sites and the effectiveness of their scientific approach and algorithms; notes that some sites have loyal followings but finds some of the matching criteria confounding; cites research by social scientists who do not believe technology can have a role in discerning compatibility.
lead_paragraph: Online dating sites defend the usefulness of their scientific approach. But a social psychology professor says that “technology is not the way to figure out who is compatible and will never be.”

headline.seo: In Online Dating, Taking a Chance on Love and Algorithms
headline.main: Taking a Chance on Love, and Algorithms
headline.print_headline: Taking a Chance on Love, and Algorithms
